data.question: What is the main ligand used in the synthesis of the europium–organic framework?
What ions can the europium–organic framework selectively sense?
Through what mechanism does the europium–organic framework sense Fe3+ and Al3+ ions?
data.answer: Through fluorescence quenching and enhancement, respectively

data.question: What is the effect of Fe3+ ions on the luminescence of the europium–organic framework?
data.answer: Fe3+ ions almost quench the luminescence of the framework

data.question: What is the effect of Al3+ ions on the luminescence of the europium–organic framework?
data.answer: Al3+ ions enhance the luminescence intensity compared to the original one

data.question: What counterions are located in the channels of the europium–organic framework?
How does the presence of Fe3+ and Al3+ ions affect the luminescence properties of the europium–organic framework over time?
data.answer: The PL intensity decreases for the Fe3+-loaded sample but increases for the Al3+-loaded sample over time

data.question: What happens to the framework of the europium–organic framework when the concentration of Fe3+ or Al3+ ions exceeds 0.001 mol L-1?
data.answer: The framework of the europium–organic framework dissolves gradually

data.question: Is the selectivity to Fe3+ and Al3+ ions interfered by the presence of other mixed metal ions?
Can the europium–organic framework sense Cu2+ ions through partial fluorescence quenching?
Does the europium–organic framework collapse immediately upon the addition of Fe3+ or Al3+ ions?
Are Na+, K+, Ca2+, Mg2+, Ba2+, Zn2+, Cd2+, Co2+, Pb2+ ions able to interfere with the selectivity of the europium–organic framework to Fe3+ and Al3+?
Does the europium–organic framework use a cation-exchange approach for sensing Fe3+ and Al3+ ions?
Is aluminum considered a trace element necessary for the human body?
Do Fe3+ ions play an essential part in a variety of vital cell functions?
What is the role of [H2N(CH3)2]+ ions in the europium–organic framework?
data.answer: They act as counterions located in the channels of the framework

data.question: What is the structural feature of the europium–organic framework that allows for selective sensing of Fe3+ and Al3+?
data.answer: The tubular channels based on the H4BTMIPA ligand

data.question: What is the effect of the cation exchange between [H2N(CH3)2]+ and metal ions on the framework?
data.answer: It results in complex 1 that can selectively sense Fe3+ and Al3+ ions through fluorescence quenching and enhancement, respectively

data.question: Does the europium–organic framework exhibit luminescence at lmax = 593, 617, 653, 696 nm upon excitation at 395 nm?
Is the detection of Fe3+ and Al3+ ions by the europium–organic framework complicated by the presence of other metal ions?
